description.plain: Erick Orrosquieta (born August 30, 1991), commonly known by his stage name Deorro, is an American DJ signed to Ultra Records. He formerly used the name TON!C.

body.plain: Erick Orrosquieta (born August 30, 1991), commonly known by his stage name Deorro, is an American DJ signed to Ultra Records. He formerly used the name TON!C.

songs.title: Bailar

description.plain:
It’s a song by Mexico-American Dj Deorro.
“Bailar” is another promotional single without being part of an album featuring Puerto Rican Merengue singer Elvis Crespo.

Elvis recognized  for his song “Suavemente” shared with People en Español details of this single.

“Working with Deorro for me has been a rewarding and very comfortable experience. There is great chemistry between this young man and I”, said Crespo.

Meanwhile , Deorro said he was “very happy” to have worked with Crespo. “I grew up listening to his music. I don’t know if he’s a fan of my music but my family and the family of my family grew up listening to his music”, he said. “I am very happy that he have decided to work with me.”

About the work of Deorro on the song, the merenguero who born in New York feels he has given new life to his musical style. “This collaboration has reinvented my sound, giving an update to my career”, he said.

Although Crespo knows the merengue is part of the musical tradition of Latin people, He recognizes that the contribution of Deorro take his music to other markets.
“It has allowed me to reach a different audience, an audience that continues to request the electronic sound that is very fashionable and very current”, he says about “Bailar” .

songs.embed_content: Read “Bailar” by Deorro on Genius

“Bailar” is another promotional single without being part of an album featuring Puerto Rican Merengue singer Elvis Crespo.

“Working with Deorro for me has been a rewarding and very comfortable experience. There is great chemistry between this young man and I”, said Crespo.

Meanwhile , Deorro said he was “very happy” to have worked with Crespo. “I grew up listening to his music. I don’t know if he’s a fan of my music but my family and the family of my family grew up listening to his music”, he said. “I am very happy that he have decided to work with me.”

About the work of Deorro on the song, the merenguero who born in New York feels he has given new life to his musical style. “This collaboration has reinvented my sound, giving an update to my career”, he said.

Although Crespo knows the merengue is part of the musical tradition of Latin people, He recognizes that the contribution of Deorro take his music to other markets.

songs.full_title: Tell Me Lies by Deorro (Ft. Lesley Roy)
songs.title: Tell Me Lies

description.plain: She has her own doubts about a relationship and knows things aren’t that great between them. Despite the bad occurrences, her heart can’t give up on her significant other. She listens to his lies -which probably deal with hope for their relationship – about “fairy tales” of their relationship being a good and healthy one.

songs.embed_content: Read “Tell Me Lies” by Deorro on Genius

annotatable.title: Tell Me Lies

body.plain: She has her own doubts about a relationship and knows things aren’t that great between them. Despite the bad occurrences, her heart can’t give up on her significant other. She listens to his lies -which probably deal with hope for their relationship – about “fairy tales” of their relationship being a good and healthy one.

songs.lyrics:
7 ContributorsTell Me Lies Lyrics[Verse 1]
My heart it doesn’t know, what you’re doing
It sees the good in you, even when you’re using
Me and all my love, a fire quick fix
Make me choose tonight, make me choose tonight

[Verse 2]
Cracks begin to show, we’re treading on ice
One more step I know, we’re cruising this time
So try and fake a smile, so they don’t see us
And all we’re trying to hide, all we’re trying to fight

[Pre-Chorus]
'Cause he don't matter what's wrong or right
It don't matter, I see it in your in eyes
You tell me lies
'Cause it don't matter what's wrong or right
It don't matter, I see it in your in eyes

[Chorus] (2x)
Tell me lies
Fairytales of you and I
Tell me we can make it right
Pretend we’ll never die
Pretend we’re not telling lies
You might also like[Verse 3]
'Cause everybody knows, and they all see it
'Cause hearts are hard to hold, when they're bleeding
The ship's about to sink, and we can't save us
It's going down tonight, and going down this time

[Verse 4]
There's something in the stars, there's something missing
We're better off apart, cause I'm out here wishin'
That we can make it right, make it feel good
I'm running out of time, I'm running out of lies

[Pre-Chorus]
'Cause it don't matter what's wrong or right
It don't matter, I see it in your in eyes
Tell me lies
'Cause it don't matter what's wrong or right
It don't matter, I see it in your in eyes

[Chorus] (2x)
Tell me lies
Fairytales of you and I
Tell me we can make it right
Pretend we’ll never die
Pretend we’re not telling lies
[Bridge]
Give me your little fix again
Give me another night if you're leaving
Tell me we're gonna try again
Tell me you want me, 'cause I need it
Give me your little fix again
Give me another night if you're leaving
Tell me you want me, 'cause I need it

[Chorus] (2x)
Tell me lies
Fairytales of you and I
Tell me we can make this right
Pretend we’ll never die
Pretend we’re not telling lies

[Outro] (4x)
Just tell me lies2Embed
